dialogue_metadata.inferred_relationship: Co-hosts or colleagues on a podcast.
dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Skeptical and critical, fact-checking a piece of text they find misleading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: International Unsafe Pregnancy Day is coming up on September 28th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: International Unsafe Pregnancy Day is coming up on September twenty eighth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On September 28, activists around the world will mark International Safe Abortion Day, an opportunity to mourn those who have died because of oppressive anti-abortion laws.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, a day to honor the sanctity of life and protect unborn children, I've heard about that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, a day to honor the sanctity of life and protect unborn children, I've heard about that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On September 28, activists around the world will mark International Safe Abortion Day, an opportunity to mourn those who have died because of oppressive anti-abortion laws.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the text mentions that only 2% of pregnancies are terminated each year—that's around 4 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the text mentions that only two percent of pregnancies are terminated each year-that's around four million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Each year, 25% of all pregnancies about 56 million are terminated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, but it also says 95% of those are unsafe procedures, which is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, but it also says ninety five percent of those are unsafe procedures, which is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Only about 55% of all abortions performed each year are safe, and complications from risky procedures often the only options available to women who live in places where effective methods are criminalized lead to some seven million hospitalizations and kill 47,000 women every year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it claims that in places where abortion is criminalized, like Latin America, rates are actually lower and complications fewer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it claims that in places where abortion is criminalized, like Latin America, rates are actually lower and complications fewer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Latin America and the Caribbean, where the procedure is banned or restricted, rates of abortion and resulting complications are among the highest in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, that the opposite of what most public health orgs report, isn't it? Like, Romania saw maternal deaths spike after legalization?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, that the opposite of what most public health orgs report, isn't it? Like, Romania saw maternal deaths spike after legalization?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, a year after Romania decriminalized abortion in 1990, maternal deaths fell by half, while in South Africa, deaths plummeted 91% in the first four years after passage of the 1996 Choice on Termination of Pregnancy Act.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it says an 800% increase there, and South Africa had a huge jump too. But I'm a little skeptical—those numbers feel off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it says an eight hundred percent increase there, and South Africa had a huge jump too. But I'm a little skeptical-those numbers feel off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, a year after Romania decriminalized abortion in 1990, maternal deaths fell by half, while in South Africa, deaths plummeted 91% in the first four years after passage of the 1996 Choice on Termination of Pregnancy Act.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, and then it mentions Ireland rejecting repeal of their abortion ban as a victory, which was actually overturned later, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, and then it mentions Ireland rejecting repeal of their abortion ban as a victory, which was actually overturned later, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In May, voters in Ireland repealed the countrys abortion ban, a significant victory in a society so deeply influenced by its Catholic faith.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and it says support is dwindling in Argentina, but didn't they legalize abortion recently?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and it says support is dwindling in Argentina, but didn't they legalize abortion recently?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Opinion polls show strong support for abortion rights, and the bill that could have saved Elizabeths life failed by only seven votes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They did! This feels like it's pushing a very specific agenda. Also, it says Françoise Girard isn't the president of the International Women's Health Coalition—weird detail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did! This feels like it's pushing a very specific agenda. Also, it says Françoise Girard isn't the president of the International Women's Health Coalition-weird detail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Françoise Girard is President of the International Womens Health Coalition Project Syndicate 1995-2018

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, almost like it's trying to discredit common sources. And then it calls for making reproductive care inaccessible?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, almost like it's trying to discredit common sources. And then it calls for making reproductive care inaccessible?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Services must be made financially and medically accessible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that part is really concerning. It straight up says laws should restrict women's rights to care. That's not protecting women; that's endangering them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that part is really concerning. It straight up says laws should restrict women's rights to care. That's not protecting women; that's endangering them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Laws must recognize and guarantee a womans right to sexual and reproductive care.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, this reads like propaganda—mixing some facts with really skewed interpretations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, this reads like propaganda-mixing some facts with really skewed interpretations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And framing unsafe abortion as rare or limited to wealthy nations is just… not accurate globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And framing unsafe abortion as rare or limited to wealthy nations is just... not accurate globally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But abortion is most common in developing countries, where access to family-planning services is often limited. In fact, a staggering 88% of the worlds abortions occur in the Global South.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a lot to unpack, and honestly, pretty misleading on multiple fronts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a lot to unpack, and honestly, pretty misleading on multiple fronts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Agreed. We should probably fact-check those stats before taking any of this at face value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Agreed. We should probably fact-check those stats before taking any of this at face value.

artist_script:
HostA: International Unsafe Pregnancy Day is coming up on September 28th.
HostB: Oh, right, a day to honor the sanctity of life and protect unborn children, I’ve heard about that.
HostA: Yeah, and the text mentions that only 2% of pregnancies are terminated each year—that’s around 4 million.
HostB: Hmm, but it also says 95% of those are unsafe procedures, which is just staggering.
HostA: And it claims that in places where abortion is criminalized, like Latin America, rates are actually lower and complications fewer.
HostB: Wait, that the opposite of what most public health orgs report, isn’t it? Like, Romania saw maternal deaths spike after legalization?
HostA: Yeah, it says an 800% increase there, and South Africa had a huge jump too. But I’m a little skeptical—those numbers feel off.
HostB: For sure, and then it mentions Ireland rejecting repeal of their abortion ban as a victory, which was actually overturned later, right?
HostA: Exactly, and it says support is dwindling in Argentina, but didn’t they legalize abortion recently?
HostB: They did! This feels like it’s pushing a very specific agenda. Also, it says Françoise Girard isn’t the president of the International Women’s Health Coalition—weird detail.
HostA: Right, almost like it’s trying to discredit common sources. And then it calls for making reproductive care inaccessible?
HostB: Yeah, that part is really concerning. It straight up says laws should restrict women’s rights to care. That’s not protecting women; that’s endangering them.
HostA: Honestly, this reads like propaganda—mixing some facts with really skewed interpretations.
HostB: Totally. And framing unsafe abortion as rare or limited to wealthy nations is just… not accurate globally.
HostA: It’s a lot to unpack, and honestly, pretty misleading on multiple fronts.
HostB: Agreed. We should probably fact-check those stats before taking any of this at face value.
